column1: Belebey (Russian: Белебе́й; Bashkir: Бәләбәй) is a town in the Republic of Bashkortostan
column3: located on the bank of the Usen River

column1: Belebey was established in 1715 and granted town status in 1781. Between 1865 and 1919 it was part of Ufa Governorate.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Belebey serves as the administrative center of Belebeyevsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Belebey—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of republic significance of Belebey is incorporated within Belebeyevsky Municipal District as Belebey Urban Settlement.
